summary: Build a romantic, interactive Valentine proposal web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with a pink/white theme, a playful Yes/No prompt where No evades the cursor, and a multi-page/step flow showing an image, Hindi shayari, a playable song list, heartfelt quotes, and virtual date ideas—designed to run easily on Android Chrome.
architectural_notes: Implement as a mobile-friendly HTML/CSS/JS experience optimized for running locally in Android Chrome.
Use a multi-step/page flow (single-page app with section transitions or separate pages) to progress through: proposal -> image -> shayari -> songs -> quotes -> date ideas.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Romantic couple illustration in a warm, meaningful style (couple-hero.dim_1400x900.png)
- Seamless subtle heart pattern background in pink/white tones (hearts-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page, mobile-friendly interactive Valentine flow with multiple full-screen steps (sections) and smooth transitions, designed to run well on Android Chrome.

Implement the opening proposal step that asks the user to be your Valentine with exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”. Make the “No” option evade interaction by moving away when the pointer/touch approaches it, making it effectively unclickable.
On clicking “Yes”, transition to a step that displays a beautiful couple image and the message text: “Good choice”.
Add the next step that displays the provided romantic Hindi shayari exactly as given, formatted in a visually beautiful layout.

Add a music step that lists the following songs and allows the user to play/pause each soundtrack on the page: 1) Ishq Hai 2) zulfein 3) Haseen 4) Ranjheya Ve 5) High on you. Implement playback using in-browser audio controls with a clean custom UI.
Add a step titled “Things My heart feels for you” and display the provided quotes in a beautiful, romantic layout.
Add a step titled “Our virtual Date ideas” and display the provided 13 date ideas in a beautiful, romantic layout.

Apply a consistent romantic visual theme across all steps using a pink and white color scheme, with cohesive typography, spacing, and decorative elements (e.g., subtle hearts, soft gradients), while keeping the UI simple and focused on the Valentine flow.

Add a simple in-flow navigation model (e.g., Next/Back where appropriate) that prevents skipping directly to later steps before accepting (clicking “Yes”), while still allowing normal sequential navigation after “Yes”.
Bundle required static assets in the frontend (images and audio) and reference them directly from the frontend so the experience works without any external network dependency once loaded.
